template.name: Oracle DB
template.description:
## Overview
Zabbix template for oracle ==========================
Steps in order to make it work: -------------------------------
1. Install ODBC drivers for your OS (Oracle) 2. Create some user in your Oracle database for Zabbix 3. Maintain your odbc.ini and add new DSN 4. Fill corresponding connect DSN in {#DSN} and {#BACKUP\_DSN} macro at your zabbix host. 5. Grant **select any dictionary** to created user at step #2. 6. If some specific permission is required for some specific item, it will be available at item description.
Future plans: -------------
* Add more performance metric items and triggers * Add support for Oracle RAC * Add compatibility for Oracle DataGuard instances
Github repo: <https://github.com/HellScre4m/zabbix-monitoring-templates>
Some hints: -----------
**Min Zabbix version** is prone to **change** at higher versions. Always check template description before getting new version.
Current supporting Oracle is **11gr2**
Feel free to fork/edit/pull request.
Version / Zabbix version: -------------------------
1.0 / 4.2+
## Author
SuNova

item.name: Archived log Primary-Standby gap
item.params: select (select max(sequence#) from v$archived_log) - (select max(sequence#) from v$archived_log where applied = 'YES') from dual;

dependency.name: DB - DG massive archive gap detected => {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger.name: DB - DG massive archive gap detected => {ITEM.VALUE1}

item.name: Last 24h backup details
item.params: select * from ( select case when status = 'COMPLETED' then 1 when status = 'FAILED' then -1 when status like 'WITH WARNINGS' then 2 when status like 'WITH ERRORS' then 3 else 0 end from v$rman_status where trunc(start_time) = trunc(sysdate-{$ORACLE_BACKUP_HOUR}/24) and operation = 'BACKUP' and (object_type='DB INCR' or object_type='DB FULL') order by start_time asc) where rownum=1;
item.description: when status = 'COMPLETED' then 1 when status = 'FAILED' then -1 when status like 'WITH WARNINGS' then 2 when status like 'WITH ERRORS' then 3 else 0

item.name: Blocked sessions count
item.params: select count(distinct sid) from v$session_blockers;

item.name: Buffer Cache Hit Ratio
Cursor Cache Hit Ratio
Database CPU Time Ratio
Database lock count
item.params: select count(1) from v$lock;

item.name: Database session count
item.params: select count(1) from v$session;

item.name: Global DB name
Host CPU Utilization %
Instance CPU count
Instance status
item.params: select status from v$instance

item.name: Instance name
item.params: select instance_name from v$instance;

item.name: Long table scans per sec
Max applied archived log
item.params: select max(sequence#) from v$archived_log where applied = 'YES';

item.name: Max archived log
item.params: select case when max(sequence#) is null then 0 else max(sequence#) end from v$archived_log;

trigger.name: Database is not in archive mode

item.name: Maximum processes
item.params: select value from v$system_parameter where name ='processes';

item.name: Maximum sessions
item.params: select value from v$system_parameter where name ='sessions';

item.name: PGA Cache Hit %
Physical Read Bytes Per Sec

dependency.name: Database Read Bps is high => {ITEM.VALUE1}
dependency.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(10m)} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_READ_BPS}) >=2
dependency.recovery_expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(#2)} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_READ_BPS}) <2

dependency.name: Database Read Bps is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}
dependency.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(5m)} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_READ_BPS}) >=2.25
dependency.recovery_expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].last()} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Read Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_READ_BPS}) <2.25

trigger.name: Database Read Bps is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}

item.name: Physical reads direct per sec
Physical reads direct temporary tablespace per sec
item.key: db.odbc.select[physical reads direct temporary tablespace per sec,{$DSN}]

item.name: Physical Reads Per Sec
Physical Write Bytes Per Sec

dependency.name: Database Write Bps is high => {ITEM.VALUE1}
dependency.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(10m)} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_WRITE_BPS}) >=2
dependency.recovery_expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(#2)} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_WRITE_BPS}) <2

dependency.name: Database Write Bps is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}
dependency.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(5m)} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_WRITE_BPS}) >=2.25
dependency.recovery_expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].last()} / ({Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Physical Write Bytes Per Sec,{$DSN}].avg(1w)} + {$MIN_WRITE_BPS}) <2.25

trigger.name: Database Write Bps is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}

item.name: Physical writes direct per sec
Physical Writes Per Sec
Redo Allocation Hit Ratio
Session blockers count
item.params: select count(distinct blocker_sid) from v$session_blockers;

item.name: Shared Pool Free %
Soft Parse Ratio
Waiting sessions count
item.params: select count(1) from v$session where username is not null and wait_time = 0 and wait_class# != 6;

discovery_rule.name: Active session discovery
discovery_rule.params: select distinct sid from v$session where username is not null and wait_class#!=6;

item_prototype.name: Session {#SID} CPU used in seconds
item_prototype.params: select value/100 from v$sesstat join v$statname using (statistic#) where name = 'CPU used by this session' and sid={#SID};

item_prototype.name: Session {#SID} SQL ID
Session {#SID} username
Session {#SID} change in CPU time per sec

trigger_prototype.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Host CPU Utilization,{$DSN}].last()}>=60 and {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[session {#SID} CPU time,{$DSN}].last()}>=0.7
trigger_prototype.name: Session {#SID} is devouring CPU!

trigger_prototype.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Host CPU Utilization,{$DSN}].last()}>=60 and {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[session {#SID} CPU time,{$DSN}].last()}>=0.6
trigger_prototype.name: Session {#SID} is eating CPU!

trigger_prototype.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[Host CPU Utilization,{$DSN}].last()}>=50 and {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[session {#SID} CPU time,{$DSN}].last()}>=0.5
trigger_prototype.name: Session {#SID} is hogging CPU!

discovery_rule.name: Archive destination discovery
discovery_rule.params: select DEST_ID from v$archive_DEST_STATUS where status='VALID' and TYPE != 'LOCAL';

item_prototype.name: Destination {#DEST_ID} status

discovery_rule.name: ASM disk discovery
discovery_rule.params: select name as disk_name, case mount_status when 'MISSING' then -3 when 'CLOSED' then -2 when 'CLOSING' then -1 when 'IGNORED' then 0 when 'OPENED' then 1 when 'CACHED' then 2 end as mount_status, case mode_status when 'OFFLINE' then 0 when 'ONLINE' then 1 end as mode_status, case state when 'NORMAL' then 1 when 'UNKNOWN' then 0 when 'ADDING' then 2 when 'DROPPING' then 3 when 'HUNG' then -1 when 'FORCING' then -2 end as state, os_mb, total_mb, free_mb from v$asm_disk_stat;

item_prototype.name: ASM disk: {#DISK_NAME}: mode status
item_prototype.params: {#MODE_STATUS}

item_prototype.name: ASM disk: {#DISK_NAME}: mount status
item_prototype.params: {#MOUNT_STATUS}
item_prototype.description: when 'MISSING' then -3 when 'CLOSED' then -2 when 'CLOSING' then -1 when 'IGNORED' then 0 when 'OPENED' then 1 when 'CACHED' then 2

item_prototype.name: ASM disk: {#DISK_NAME}: state
item_prototype.params: {#STATE}
item_prototype.description: when 'NORMAL' then 1 when 'UNKNOWN' then 0 when 'ADDING' then 2 when 'DROPPING' then 3 when 'HUNG' then -1 when 'FORCING' then -2

item_prototype.name: ASM disk: {#DISK_NAME}: total space
item_prototype.params: {#TOTAL_MB}

item_prototype.name: ASM disk: {#DISK_NAME}: free space
item_prototype.params: {#FREE_MB}

item_prototype.name: ASM disk: {#DISK_NAME}: pct free
item_prototype.params: {#FREE_MB} / {#TOTAL_MB} * 100

trigger_prototype.name: ASM disk {#DISK_NAME} extremely low free space => {ITEM.VALUE1}

dependency.name: ASM disk {#DISK_NAME} very low free space => {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger_prototype.name: ASM disk {#DISK_NAME} very low free space => {ITEM.VALUE1}

dependency.name: ASM disk {#DISK_NAME} extremely low free space => {ITEM.VALUE1}

discovery_rule.name: Blocking session discovery
discovery_rule.params: select distinct blocking_session as SID from v$session where blocking_session is not NULL;

item_prototype.name: Total wait time on Blocking session: {#SID}
item_prototype.params: select sum(seconds_in_wait) "SECONDS_IN_WAIT" from v$session where blocking_session= {#SID} and seconds_in_wait is not null;

discovery_rule.name: Flash Recovery Area Discovery
discovery_rule.params: select name, space_limit, space_used from v$recovery_file_dest;

item_prototype.name: FRA: {#NAME}: pct_used
item_prototype.params: {#SPACE_USED}/{#SPACE_LIMIT}*100

dependency.name: FRA space usage is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger_prototype.name: FRA space usage is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}

item_prototype.name: FRA: {#NAME}: size
item_prototype.params: {#SPACE_LIMIT}

item_prototype.name: FRA: {#NAME}: space_used
item_prototype.params: {#SPACE_USED}

discovery_rule.name: Scheduler jobs discovery
discovery_rule.params: select job_name, owner, round(cast(req_start_date as date) - date '1970-01-01') * 24 *3600 as req_start_date, round(cast(actual_start_date as date) - date '1970-01-01') * 24 *3600 as actual_start_date, error#, run_duration from user_scheduler_job_run_details where rownum=1 order by req_start_date desc;

item_prototype.name: Schema {#OWNER}: size
item_prototype.params: select sum(bytes) from dba_segments where owner='{#OWNER}'

discovery_rule.name: Tablespace discovery
discovery_rule.params: select tablespace_name, case when contents in ('PERMANENT', 'UNDO') then (select sum(bytes) from dba_data_files where tablespace_name=t.tablespace_name) when contents='TEMPORARY' then (select sum(bytes) from dba_temp_files where tablespace_name=t.tablespace_name) end as "SIZE", case when contents in ('PERMANENT', 'UNDO') then (select sum( case when autoextensible = 'YES' then maxbytes else bytes end) from dba_data_files where tablespace_name=t.tablespace_name) when contents='TEMPORARY' then (select sum( case when autoextensible = 'YES' then maxbytes else bytes end) from dba_temp_files where tablespace_name=t.tablespace_name) end as "MAX_SIZE", case bigfile when 'YES' then 1 when 'NO' then 0 end "BIGFILE", case contents when 'PERMANENT' then 1 when 'TEMPORARY' then 2 when 'UNDO' then 3 end "CONTENTS" from dba_tablespaces t group by tablespace_name, bigfile, contents;

item_prototype.name: Tablespace: {#TABLESPACE_NAME}: bigfile
item_prototype.params: {#BIGFILE}

item_prototype.name: Tablespace: {#TABLESPACE_NAME}: contents
item_prototype.params: {#CONTENTS}

item_prototype.name: Tablespace: {#TABLESPACE_NAME}: max_size
item_prototype.params: {#MAX_SIZE}

item_prototype.name: Tablespace: {#TABLESPACE_NAME}: pct_used
item_prototype.params: {#SIZE}/{#MAX_SIZE}*100

item_prototype.name: Tablespace: {#TABLESPACE_NAME}: size
item_prototype.params: {#SIZE}

dependency.name: Tablespace {#TABLESPACE_NAME} space usage is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger_prototype.name: Tablespace {#TABLESPACE_NAME} space usage is very high => {ITEM.VALUE1}

discovery_rule.name: Top lasting SQLs discovery
discovery_rule.params: select * from ( select SQL_ID, CHILD_ADDRESS from v$sql where last_active_time > systimestamp - 1/24 order by elapsed_time desc) where rownum < 11;

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} bind variables
item_prototype.params:
with temp as ( select NAME, DATATYPE_STRING, POSITION, case datatype when 180 then to_char(anydata.accesstimestamp(value_anydata), 'DD-MM-YYYY HH24:MI:SS.FF9') when 181 then to_char(anydata.accesstimestamptz(value_anydata), 'DD-MM-YYYY HH24:MI:SS.FF9 TZR') when 183 then to_char(anydata.accessintervalYM(value_anydata) || ' ' || anydata.accessintervalDS(value_anydata)) when 12 then to_char(anydata.accessdate(value_anydata), 'DD-MM-YYYY HH24:MI:SS') else nvl(value_string, 'Null') end data_value FROM V$SQL_BIND_CAPTURE where sql_id = '{#SQL_ID}' and child_address = q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]'
) SELECT listagg(NAME || ' := (' || DATATYPE_STRING || ') ' || data_value, chr(10)) within group ( order by position asc) from temp START WITH POSITION = 1 CONNECT BY POSITION = PRIOR POSITION + 1;

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} CPU time
item_prototype.params: select CPU_TIME from v$sql where sql_id='{#SQL_ID}' and child_address=q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]';

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} parsing schema
item_prototype.params: select parsing_schema_name from v$sql where sql_id='{#SQL_ID}' and child_address=q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]';

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} physical read bytes
item_prototype.params: select PHYSICAL_READ_BYTES from v$sql where sql_id='{#SQL_ID}' and child_address=q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]';

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} physical write bytes
item_prototype.params: select PHYSICAL_WRITE_BYTES from v$sql where sql_id='{#SQL_ID}' and child_address=q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]';

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} plan
item_prototype.params: with temp as ( select * FROM V$SQL_PLAN where sql_id = '{#SQL_ID}' and child_address = q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]' ) SELECT listagg( ID || '|' || lpad(' ', level - 1) || operation || ' ' || options || ' ' || case when object_name is not null then chr(9) || object_owner || '.' || object_name || '(' || object_type || ')|' else '' end || case when partition_start is not null then chr(9) || 'PARTITION START: ' || partition_start || '|' else '' end || case when partition_stop is not null then chr(9) || 'PARTITION STOP: ' || partition_stop || '|' else '' end || case when optimizer is not null then chr(9) || optimizer || '|' else '' end || case when cardinality is not null then chr(9) || cardinality || ' DISTINCT ROWS|' else '' end || case when bytes is not null then chr(9) || bytes || ' BYTES|' else '' end || case when cpu_cost is not null then chr(9) || 'CPU COST: ' || CPU_COST || '|' else '' end || case when temp_space is not null then chr(9) || 'TEMP SPACE: ' || TEMP_SPACE || '|' else '' end || case when ACCESS_PREDICATES is not null then chr(9) || 'ACCESS PREDICATES: ' || ACCESS_PREDICATES || '|' else '' end || case when FILTER_PREDICATES is not null then chr(9) || 'FILTER PREDICATES: ' || FILTER_PREDICATES || ' |' else '' end, chr(10)) within group ( order by id desc) from temp START WITH id = 0 CONNECT BY prior id = parent_id;

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID}:{#CHILD_ADDRESS} text
item_prototype.params: select dbms_lob.substr(sql_fulltext,5000,1) from v$sql where sql_id='{#SQL_ID}' and child_address=q'[{#CHILD_ADDRESS}]';

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID} total CPU time
Top SQL {#SQL_ID} total physical read bytes
item_prototype.key: db.odbc.select[Top SQL {#SQL_ID} total physical read bytes,{$DSN}]

item_prototype.name: Top SQL {#SQL_ID} total physical write bytes
item_prototype.key: db.odbc.select[Top SQL {#SQL_ID} total physical write bytes,{$DSN}]

discovery_rule.name: Waiting session discovery
discovery_rule.params: select distinct sid from v$session where username is not null and wait_time = 0 and wait_class# != 6;

item_prototype.name: Session {#SID} total wait time in seconds
item_prototype.params: select case when wait_time = 0 and WAIT_CLASS# != 6 then seconds_in_wait else 0 end from v$session where sid={#SID};

trigger.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[db session count,{$DSN}].last()}>={Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[max number of sessions,{$DSN}].last()} * 0.95
trigger.name: Database extreme session count => {ITEM.VALUE1}

trigger.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[db session count,{$DSN}].last()}>={Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[max number of sessions,{$DSN}].last()} * 0.6
trigger.name: Database high session count

dependency.name: Database very high session count => {ITEM.VALUE1}
dependency.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[db session count,{$DSN}].last()}>={Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[max number of sessions,{$DSN}].last()} * 0.8

trigger.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[db session count,{$DSN}].last()}>={Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[max number of sessions,{$DSN}].last()} * 0.8
trigger.name: Database very high session count => {ITEM.VALUE1}

dependency.name: Database extreme session count => {ITEM.VALUE1}
dependency.expression: {Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[db session count,{$DSN}].last()}>={Oracle DB:db.odbc.select[max number of sessions,{$DSN}].last()} * 0.95
